transcript.title: MARK LATHAM COMMENTS ON STALEY UNACCEPTABLE
transcript.content:
Mark Latham';s remarks on the ABC TV Lateline programme last night in which he described former Liberal Party President Tony Staley as âthat deformed characterâ require an immediate and unconditional apology.
These comments are tasteless and insensitive.
Other remarks made by Mr Latham on the same programme and repeated in a speech to the Young Labor Annual Conference today also amount to nothing more than personal attacks.
Simon Crean says he wants to lift parliamentary standards.
Mark Latham';s remarks about Tony Staley represent an acid test for him and the acting leader of the Opposition Jenny Macklin. Will they or won';t they discipline Mr Latham.
